How can I mint new coins of a currency I've defined with Verus?

To mint new coins of a currency you've defined with Verus, you can use the `sendcurrency` command with the `mintnew` option. For example, if you've defined a currency called "mycoin" with `proofprotocol` set to 2, you can mint new coins as follows:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
This command mints 10,000 new coins of "mycoin" and sends them to the address "mike@".

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
